page.title: 08Pebworth Fire Station
page.content: Pebworth Retained Fire Station is manned 24 hours by part time firemen (milkman, carpenter, farmer, builder, lorry driver and 2 security guards and 3 full time firemen who work at the nearby military camp). They wear yellow protective clothing and helmets and are called by personal alerters to domestic incidents, those on farms and at Long Lartin maximum security prison. The new fire engine (a red Dennis water tender) is fully equipped to deal with any emergency. Retained firmen must live and work within 3 mins. of the station. The present fire station built 30 yrs. ago, where they practice each Tuesday night, also contains the nuclear early warning system. For over 50 years there has been a tradition of family involvement and loyalty to the fire service by the men of Pebworth
